benchmark_details.name: Live-E2T (Real-time Threat Monitoring in Video via Deduplicated Event Reasoning and Chain-of-Thought)
benchmark_details.overview: Live-E2T is a novel framework for real-time threat monitoring that identifies threatening behaviors in video streams and provides reasoning and assessment of threat events through explanatory text. It uniquely combines high performance and explainability through its hierarchical understanding mechanism, event deduplication, and fine-tuned language model.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop a robust, real-time threat monitoring system capable of accurate threat detection and providing interpretable reasoning for decision-making.

data.source: XD-Violence, UCF-Crime, Real Life Violence Situations Dataset, Large-scale Anomaly Detection dataset

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on standard evaluation paradigms and comparative analysis with existing methods.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in threat detection and explainability.
methodology.baseline_results: Achieved AP of 91.38% on XD-Violence and AUC of 90.53% on UCF-Crime.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments were conducted to validate performance against state-of-the-art methods.
